description: Creates an Amazon Redshift event notification subscription. This action requires an ARN (Amazon Resource Name) of an Amazon SNS topic created by either the Amazon Redshift console, the Amazon SNS console, or the Amazon SNS API. To obtain an ARN with Amazon SNS, you must create a topic in Amazon SNS and subscribe to the topic. The ARN is displayed in the SNS console. You can specify the source type, and lists of Amazon Redshift source IDs, event categories, and event severities. Notifications will be sent for all events you want that match those criteria. For example, you can specify source type = cluster, source ID = my-cluster-1 and mycluster2, event categories = Availability, Backup, and severity = ERROR. The subscription will only send notifications for those ERROR events in the Availability and Backup categories for the specified clusters. If you specify both the source type and source IDs, such as source type = cluster and source identifier = my-cluster-1, notifications will be sent for all the cluster events for my-cluster-1. If you specify a source type but do not specify a source identifier, you will receive notice of the events for the objects of that type in your Amazon Web Services account. If you do not specify either the SourceType nor the SourceIdentifier, you will be notified of events generated from all Amazon Redshift sources belonging to your Amazon Web Services account. You must specify a source type if you specify a source ID.

parameters.name: SubscriptionName
parameters.description: The name of the event subscription to be created. Constraints: Cannot be null, empty, or blank. Must contain from 1 to 255 alphanumeric characters or hyphens. First character must be a letter. Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.

parameters.name: SnsTopicArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic used to transmit the event notifications. The ARN is created by Amazon SNS when you create a topic and subscribe to it.

parameters.name: SourceType
parameters.description: The type of source that will be generating the events. For example, if you want to be notified of events generated by a cluster, you would set this parameter to cluster. If this value is not specified, events are returned for all Amazon Redshift objects in your Amazon Web Services account. You must specify a source type in order to specify source IDs. Valid values: cluster, cluster-parameter-group, cluster-security-group, cluster-snapshot, and scheduled-action.

parameters.name: SourceIds
parameters.description: A list of one or more identifiers of Amazon Redshift source objects. All of the objects must be of the same type as was specified in the source type parameter. The event subscription will return only events generated by the specified objects. If not specified, then events are returned for all objects within the source type specified. Example: my-cluster-1, my-cluster-2 Example: my-snapshot-20131010 (string) ---

parameters.name: EventCategories
parameters.description: Specifies the Amazon Redshift event categories to be published by the event notification subscription. Values: configuration, management, monitoring, security, pending (string) ---

parameters.name: Severity
parameters.description: Specifies the Amazon Redshift event severity to be published by the event notification subscription. Values: ERROR, INFO.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: A list of tag instances. (dict) --- A tag consisting of a name/value pair for a resource. Key (string) --- The key, or name, for the resource tag. Value (string) --- The value for the resource tag.

nested_params.name: Key
nested_params.description: The key, or name, for the resource tag.

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: The value for the resource tag.

nested_items.name: CustomerAwsId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services account associated with the Amazon Redshift event notification subscription.

nested_items.name: CustSubscriptionId
nested_items.description: The name of the Amazon Redshift event notification subscription.

nested_items.name: SnsTopicArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic used by the event notification subscription.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the Amazon Redshift event notification subscription.
Can be one of the following: active | no-permission | topic-not-exist.

The status 'no-permission' indicates that Amazon Redshift no longer has permission to post to the Amazon SNS topic. The status 'topic-not-exist' indicates that the topic was deleted after the subscription was created.

nested_items.name: SubscriptionCreationTime
nested_items.description: The date and time the Amazon Redshift event notification subscription was created.

nested_items.name: SourceType
nested_items.description: The source type of the events returned by the Amazon Redshift event notification, such as cluster, cluster-snapshot, cluster-parameter-group, cluster-security-group, or scheduled-action.

nested_items.name: SourceIdsList
nested_items.description: A list of the sources that publish events to the Amazon Redshift event notification subscription.

nested_items.name: EventCategoriesList
nested_items.description: The list of Amazon Redshift event categories specified in the event notification subscription.

nested_items.name: Severity
nested_items.description: The event severity specified in the Amazon Redshift event notification subscription.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: A boolean value indicating whether the subscription is enabled; true indicates that the subscription is enabled.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: The list of tags for the event subscription.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The key, or name, for the resource tag.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value for the resource tag.
